TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SiteMapDataSourceView extends System.Web.UI.DataSourceView

Docs.summary: Provides a strongly typed object for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSource> control enables ASP.NET data-bound controls, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> controls, to bind to site map data. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> class is used by controls developers but it is not used by page developers nor in page code.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSource> returns a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> for a specified hierarchical path when the <xref:System.Web.UI.HierarchicalDataSourceView.Select%2A> method is called. Like all hierarchical data source view objects, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> is not named; rather, its is identified by its unique hierarchical path.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> is a wrapper class on a <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> collection. The <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> class implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IHierarchicalEnumerable> interface, which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> class returns from a call to `Select` method. Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSource> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> work with <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNode> objects, the view maintains an internal <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> to contain them. The collection is initialized using the view's constructors and accessed with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.Select%2A> method.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

The to add to the internal .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new named instance of the class, adding the single specified node to the internal collection of nodes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> class is a wrapper class on a <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> object. Creating a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.%23ctor%2A> constructor initializes the internal node collection with a single <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNode> object. The site map structure is navigated using the node as a point of reference.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> class is a wrapper class on a <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> object. Creating a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.%23ctor%2A> constructor initializes the internal node collection with the <xref:System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection> that is passed to the constructor.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView> class implements the inherited <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.ExecuteSelect%2A> method to retrieve a set of nodes that represents the site navigation structure for the current ASP.NET application. Page developers and data-bound control authors do not call the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.ExecuteSelect%2A> method directly; instead, use the publicly exposed <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.Select%2A> method.

Docs.exception: The passed to the specify that the data source should perform some additional work while retrieving data to enable paging or sorting through the retrieved data, but the data source control does not support the requested capability.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.Select%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.ExecuteSelect%2A> method, passing the `arguments` parameter. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SiteMapDataSourceView.Select%2A> method is used by controls developers but it is not used by page developers nor in page code.

Docs.exception: The passed to the specify that the data source should perform some additional work while retrieving data to enable paging or sorting through the retrieved data, but the data source control does not support the requested capability.
